availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Johnson. Father of Jane Johnson, Patsey Johnson, Mary Ann Johnson, Shelby Johnson, Rosaline Johnson, James Johnson, Elizabeth Johnson, and Nathan Johnson. Farmer in Boyle County in 1860. Mustered into service as a private in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) on September 8, 1862. Mustered out of service on September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, p. 730. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Precinct 1, p. 136. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 222. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 90.
